title: Astronauts conduct EVA to lay groundwork for final set of iROSA arrays
summary: Astronauts Koichi Wakata and Nicole Mann are conducting a spacewalk that will enable the final set of upgraded ISS Roll-Out Solar Array (iROSA) “solar wings” to be installed on ISS sometime this summer.

title: Watch live: Astronauts on spacewalk to prep for new ISS solar arrays
summary: Japanese astronaut Koichi Wakata and NASA astronaut Nicole Mann suited up and floated outside the International Space Station Friday for a planned six-and-a-half hour spacewalk to prepare the lab for arrival of another pair of new solar arrays later this year.

title: ESA seeks global adoption of “zero debris” policy
summary: The head of the European Space agency says he hopes to have a “zero debris” policy for European spacecraft in place in the next few years, an approach he says he would like to see expanded globally.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX reaches ‘ludicrous’ cadence; ABL explains RS1 failure
summary: "This evidence suggests that an unwanted fire spread to our avionics system."

title: Chinese startups conduct hot fire tests for mini version of SpaceX’s Starship
summary: A Chinese launch startup has performed hot fire tests as part of development of a planned reusable stainless-steel rocket apparently inspired by SpaceX’s Starship.

title: NASA to Participate in Aerospace Conference, Discuss New Collaboration
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson, Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy, Bhavya Lal, associate administrator for Technology, Policy, and Strategy, as well as other agency speakers, will participate in the 2023 American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) SciTech Forum from Monday, Jan. 23, to Friday, Jan. 27, in National Harbor, Maryland.

title: U.S. Space Force chief calls for greater collaboration with allies
summary: Gen. B. Chance Saltzman, chief of space operations of the U.S. Space Force, in a memo outlining his priorities said the service should pursue stronger partnerships with allies.

title: SpaceX launches first Starlink mission of 2023 after eight delays
summary: A Falcon 9 rocket has successfully launched SpaceX’s Starlink 2-4 mission after seven delays pushed it from November 2022 to January 2023....

title: HawkEye 360 satellites to provide data for U.S. Space Force threat-detection system
summary: Slingshot Aerospace is developing a system for the U.S. Space Force that will use data from HawkEye 360’s satellites to identify potential threats to GPS signals

title: Geostationary sounder is a key ingredient of near-term forecasts
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s next generation of geostationary weather satellites will significantly improve weather forecasting thanks to the addition of a hyperspectral infrared sounder.
